name: Inverted Rows
how_to_perform:
1. Find a sturdy bar or rig at waist height that you can hang from with your hands shoulder-width apart.

2. Place your hands on the bar with your palms facing away from your body and engage your core to support your lower back.

3. Keeping your feet flat on the ground, pull yourself up towards the bar by lifting your heels off the ground and leaning back slightly.

4. Lower yourself back down to a suspended position, keeping your elbows close to your body and your shoulders relaxed.

5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on squeezing your lats and pulling muscles at the top of the movement.

6. To reduce strain on your hands, alternate hands or use an underhook grip if possible.
short_summary: Inverted rows are a back exercise that target the latissimus dorsi, trapezius, and rhomboids, effectively strengthening your upper back muscles with varying levels of intensity.
